thread.title: Family speak out after 17-year-old stabbed
thread.title_full: Family speak out after 17-year-old stabbed | Central - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Family speak out after 17-year-old stabbed
text:
The family of a stabbed teenager have described being "ripped apart" by his death.
17-year-old Liam Hunt died following an assault in St George's Street in Northampton on February 14, after reports he had suffered severe neck injuries.
His family issued a statement on Tuesday one week after his death.
They said:
We as a family have been ripped apart. We are devastated and there is nothing but a massive void left in our lives.
He was not only our son he was a brother, grandson, nephew and cousin. Liam had his entire life ahead of him until he was so cruelly taken from us.
– Family of Liam Hunt Police have continued to appeal for witnesses.
Detective Inspector Phil Mills, said:
It's now been one week since Liam died and I wanted to get our officers out there to show the community we are doing everything we can.
– Detective Inspector Phil Mills Five teenagers are accused of murder - including 18-year-old James Dodd, of Sentinel Road, Northampton - and were remanded in custody after appearing at Birmingham Crown Court on Tuesday.
The four other boys, aged between 16 and 17, cannot be named for legal reasons.
All defendants are due to appear at Northampton Crown Court on May 19.
A sixth suspect, a 20-year-old man, has also been arrested today on suspicion of murder.
 Northamptonshire East Midlands
